intro: Cyrtandra mauiensis, commonly known as Maui's Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cyrtandra mauiensis is considered a rare and endangered species.
